data.description: We are looking for undergraduate or masters-level (non-MBA) students majoring in sciences, business administration, mathematics/statistics, computer science, or a related field for a 12-week internship role in Wilmington, DE from May 18 2026 to August 7 2026. Position Duties:Positions are available in the below groups:Cardiovascular, Renal, and Metabolism Medicines Group:Execute primary market research and deliver relevant, actionable, differentiating insights – inclusive of brand positioning, HCP/Patient segmentation, creative concept testing, target patient identification, KPI tracking and forecast demand studiesSummarize and present findings through various communication channels; be able to “tell the story” to senior stakeholdersCollect, assess, and deliver global and/or regional brand performance metricsBuild predictive models to assess brand performance, uncover prescriber behavior through syndicated datasets.Assist in developing product volume forecasts to feed into strategic and operational planning processes.Use SQL, Python or R to extract data and perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends and patterns relevant to sales performance. Respiratory & Immunology Medicines Group:Specific projects can include positioning, HCP and patient segmentations, unbranded and branded lexicon and message testing, creative concept testing, target patient identification, KPI tracking and demand studies.Summarize and present findings through various communication channels; be able to “tell the story” to senior stakeholders.Collect, assess and deliver global and/or regional brand performance metrics.Build predictive models to assess brand performance, uncover prescriber behavior through syndicated datasets.Use SQL, Python or R to extract data and perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends and patterns relevant to sales performance.Build predictive models to assess brand performance, uncover prescriber behavior through syndicated datasets.Assist in developing product volume forecasts to feed into strategic and operational planning processes.Position Requirements:Undergraduate or masters-level (non-MBA) students majoring in sciences, business administration, mathematics/statistics, computer science, or a related fieldCandidates must have an expected graduation date after August 2026.Understanding of MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is required.Coding skills such as Python, C++, or SQLUS Work Authorization is required at time of application.This role will not be providing CPT support.Ability to report onsite to Wilmington, DE 3-5 days a week. This role will not provide relocation assistance.Compensation range: $31 - $41.50 hourlyDate Posted04-Dec-2025Closing Date30-Dec-2025Our mission is to build an inclusive environment where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. In furtherance of that mission, we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their protected characteristics. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please complete the corresponding section in the application form.
requirements: Candidates must have an expected graduation date after August 2026.
Understanding of MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is required.
US Work Authorization is required at time of application.
responsibilities: Assist in developing product volume forecasts to feed into strategic and operational planning processes.
Assist in developing product volume forecasts to feed into strategic and operational planning processes.
This role will not be providing CPT support.
Ability to report onsite to Wilmington, DE 3-5 days a week. This role will not provide relocation assistance.
